name: Complete Blood Count (CBC)
description: A CBC measures different components of your blood, including red and white blood cells, hemoglobin, hematocrit, and platelets.
purpose: To evaluate overall health and detect a variety of disorders, such as anemia, infection, and leukemia.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms like weakness, fatigue, fever, inflammation, bruising, or bleeding.
preparation: No special preparation is needed. You can eat and drink normally unless your doctor advises otherwise.
procedure: A blood sample is taken from a vein in your arm using a small needle.
normal_ranges: Ranges vary by age and gender. Example: WBC 4,500-11,000 cells/mcL. Always consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Blood Glucose Test
description: Measures the level of glucose (sugar) in your blood after fasting.
purpose: To screen for, diagnose, and monitor diabetes or prediabetes.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of high or low blood sugar, or as part of a routine health check.
preparation: 8-12 hours fasting required. Only water is allowed before the test.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Normal: 70-99 mg/dL. Prediabetes: 100-125 mg/dL. Diabetes: 126 mg/dL or higher. Always consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Hemoglobin A1c
description: Measures your average blood sugar levels over the past 2-3 months.
purpose: To diagnose and monitor diabetes.
when_to_get: If you have diabetes or are at risk for diabetes.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Normal: below 5.7%. Prediabetes: 5.7%-6.4%. Diabetes: 6.5% or higher.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Lipid Profile
description: A group of tests that measure the amount of cholesterol and triglycerides in your blood.
purpose: To assess your risk of developing cardiovascular disease.
when_to_get: As part of a routine health check, or if you have risk factors for heart disease.
preparation: You may be asked to fast (no food or drink except water) for 9-12 hours before the test.
procedure: A blood sample is taken from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Total cholesterol: less than 200 mg/dL. LDL: less than 100 mg/dL. HDL: 40 mg/dL or higher. Triglycerides: less than 150 mg/dL. Always consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Cardiac Enzymes
description: Measures enzymes released into the blood when the heart muscle is damaged.
purpose: To help diagnose a heart attack or other heart conditions.
when_to_get: If you have chest pain or symptoms of a heart attack.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Normal values depend on the specific enzyme. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Thyroid Function Test
description: Measures levels of thyroid hormones (T3, T4) and TSH in your blood.
purpose: To diagnose thyroid disorders such as hypothyroidism or hyperthyroidism.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of thyroid dysfunction (fatigue, weight changes, etc.).
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: TSH: 0.4-4.0 mIU/L. T3 and T4 ranges vary. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Cortisol Test
description: Measures the level of cortisol, a stress hormone, in your blood.
purpose: To diagnose disorders of the adrenal gland, such as Addison's disease or Cushing's syndrome.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of adrenal gland disorders.
preparation: Morning sample preferred. Follow your doctor's instructions.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm, or a saliva/urine sample may be used.
normal_ranges: Ranges vary by time of day and lab. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Insulin Level Test
description: Measures the amount of insulin in your blood.
purpose: To help diagnose the cause of hypoglycemia or to monitor insulin resistance.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of low blood sugar or are being evaluated for insulin resistance.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Ranges vary by lab. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Liver Function Test
description: Measures enzymes and proteins in your blood to assess liver health.
purpose: To detect liver disease or damage.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of liver problems or as part of a routine check.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: ALT: 7-56 U/L, AST: 10-40 U/L, ALP: 44-147 U/L, Bilirubin: 0.1-1.2 mg/dL. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Kidney Function Test
description: Measures creatinine and BUN levels to assess kidney health.
purpose: To detect kidney disease or monitor kidney function.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of kidney problems or as part of a routine check.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Creatinine: 0.6-1.3 mg/dL, BUN: 7-20 mg/dL. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Vitamin D Test
description: Measures the level of vitamin D in your blood.
purpose: To detect vitamin D deficiency or monitor supplementation.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of deficiency or are at risk.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: 20-50 ng/mL is considered adequate. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Vitamin B12 Test
description: Measures the level of vitamin B12 in your blood.
purpose: To detect vitamin B12 deficiency.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of deficiency or are at risk.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: 190-950 pg/mL is considered normal. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Food Allergy Panel
description: Tests for allergic reactions to common foods by measuring IgE antibodies.
purpose: To identify food allergies.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of food allergy (rash, swelling, etc.).
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Results depend on the specific allergen. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Environmental Allergy Test
description: Tests for allergic reactions to environmental allergens like pollen, dust, and pet dander.
purpose: To identify environmental allergies.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of allergy (sneezing, runny nose, etc.).
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Results depend on the specific allergen. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Comprehensive Metabolic Panel
description: A group of blood tests that provide information about your body's chemical balance and metabolism.
purpose: To assess overall health and screen for a variety of disorders.
when_to_get: As part of a routine health check or if you have symptoms of metabolic imbalance.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Ranges vary by component. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Basic Metabolic Panel
description: A group of blood tests that measure different chemicals in the blood.
purpose: To assess kidney function, blood sugar, and electrolyte and acid/base balance.
when_to_get: As part of a routine health check or if you have symptoms of metabolic imbalance.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Ranges vary by component. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: C-Reactive Protein
description: Measures the level of C-reactive protein, a marker of inflammation in the body.
purpose: To detect inflammation due to infection or chronic disease.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of infection or inflammation.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Less than 10 mg/L is considered normal. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate
description: Measures how quickly red blood cells settle at the bottom of a test tube. A marker of inflammation.
purpose: To detect inflammation in the body.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of infection or inflammation.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Ranges vary by age and gender. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Prostate Specific Antigen
description: Measures the level of PSA in the blood, a marker for prostate cancer.
purpose: To screen for and monitor prostate cancer.
when_to_get: If you are a male over 50 or have risk factors for prostate cancer.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Less than 4.0 ng/mL is considered normal. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: CA-125 Test
description: Measures the level of CA-125, a marker for ovarian cancer.
purpose: To help diagnose and monitor ovarian cancer.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms or risk factors for ovarian cancer.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Less than 35 U/mL is considered normal. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: CEA Test
description: Measures the level of CEA, a marker for colorectal and other cancers.
purpose: To help diagnose and monitor colorectal and other cancers.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms or risk factors for colorectal cancer.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Less than 2.5 ng/mL (non-smokers) or 5.0 ng/mL (smokers) is considered normal. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: AFP Test
description: Measures the level of alpha-fetoprotein, a marker for liver cancer.
purpose: To help diagnose and monitor liver cancer.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms or risk factors for liver cancer.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Less than 10 ng/mL is considered normal. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Testosterone Test
description: Measures the level of testosterone, a male sex hormone, in the blood.
purpose: To diagnose hormone imbalances or infertility in men.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of low or high testosterone.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: 270-1070 ng/dL is considered normal for adult males. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Estrogen Test
description: Measures the level of estrogen, a female sex hormone, in the blood.
purpose: To diagnose hormone imbalances or infertility in women.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of low or high estrogen.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Ranges vary by age and menstrual cycle. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Progesterone Test
description: Measures the level of progesterone, a female reproductive hormone, in the blood.
purpose: To diagnose ovulation problems or infertility in women.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of low or high progesterone.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Ranges vary by menstrual cycle. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Folate Test
description: Measures the level of folic acid (vitamin B9) in the blood.
purpose: To detect folate deficiency.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of deficiency or are at risk.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: 2.7-17.0 ng/mL is considered normal. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Iron Studies
description: Measures iron, TIBC, and ferritin levels in the blood.
purpose: To diagnose iron deficiency or overload.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of anemia or iron overload.
procedure: A blood sample is drawn from a vein in your arm.
normal_ranges: Iron: 60-170 mcg/dL, TIBC: 240-450 mcg/dL, Ferritin: 12-300 ng/mL. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: Minimal risks: slight pain or bruising at the puncture site.

name: Urinalysis
description: A complete analysis of urine to detect a wide range of disorders.
purpose: To screen for urinary tract infections, kidney disease, and diabetes.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of urinary tract infection or as part of a routine check.
procedure: A urine sample is collected in a sterile container.
normal_ranges: Results depend on the component tested. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: None.

name: Stool Occult Blood
description: Detects hidden (occult) blood in the stool, a possible sign of colon cancer or polyps.
purpose: To screen for colon cancer or gastrointestinal bleeding.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of GI bleeding or as part of routine screening.
preparation: Special diet restrictions may be required. Follow your doctor's instructions.
procedure: A stool sample is collected and tested for blood.
normal_ranges: Negative (no blood detected) is normal. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: None.

name: Helicobacter Pylori Test
description: Detects infection with H. pylori bacteria, which can cause ulcers.
purpose: To diagnose H. pylori infection.
when_to_get: If you have symptoms of peptic ulcer disease.
preparation: Fasting not required, but certain medications may need to be stopped. Follow your doctor's instructions.
procedure: A stool, breath, or blood sample may be used.
normal_ranges: Negative (no infection) is normal. Consult your doctor for interpretation.
risks: None.
